properties.description:
Cashmere Rd from #16 to Thorrington Rd. Works will begin outside #16 Cashmere Rd, and progress west towards the Thorrington Rd intersection. The replacement of the waste water
main will be carried out under a contra flow with TSL during the day, and Thorrington Rd will be closed. (TMP 1a&1b)
Once mainline works are completed, repair works will begin on the 4 laterals that cross Cashmere Rd. These laterals will be completed in two
stages under stop/go at night. The first half of the laterals will be completed under an extension of the daytime closure, closing the east
bound lane, with alternating traffic using the westbound lane. (TMP 2a&2b)
The excavation on the northern kerb will then be backfilled and resurfaced, and the TTM closure will be reversed, with works moving towards
the southern kerb, and the second half of the laterals will be completed, also under a stop/go at night.
Works will involve investigation of the damaged sections of waste water main and laterals. Theses sections will then be excavated replaced,
backfilled reinstated and resurfaced up to road level.
Works are expected to take up to 6 weeks to complete. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: All Day (24 hours a day)
properties.impact: Cyclists Affected. Bus Route / Stop Changes. Property Access Affected. Vehicle Lane(s) Closed. Shoulder Closure.

properties.description:
Thistledown Place
Lomond place
St Lukes St. Thistledown Pl Quadraplex 11/01/2016 ? 01/04/2016
These works will be in the cul-de-sac of Thistledown Pl. Road closure will be deployed for any major construction movements and open
trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main.. The work site will be reduced to a shoulder closure or lane
width reduction wherever possible. The eastern footpath that leads into reserve will be blocked for these works, with pedestrians being
directed to the western footpath. (TMP 1)
Lomond Pl Lift station 18/01/2016 ? 01/04/2016
These works will be on the southern kerb close to the cul-de-sac of Lomond Pl . Road closure with a priority give way on Clydesdale St will be
deployed for any major construction movements and open trenching for the connection of the proposed lift station to the waste water main..
The work site will be reduced to a priority give way or contra flow wherever possible. The southern footpath will be closed for the duration of
works. (TMP 2&3)

St Lukes St Lift Station 18/01/2016 ? 20/03/2016
These works will be between #32 and #42 St Lukes St. A one way system will be established for the duration of works. Direction of one way
system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works will be completed before
works on the quadraplex begin. (TMP 4)
St Lukes St Quadraplex 21/03/2016 ? 30/06/2016
These works will be east of the corner of St Johns St and St Lukes St outside #108. A one way system will be established for the duration of
works. Direction of one way system will be eastbound to accommodate for proposed road closure on St Johns St (TMP#31739) These works
will be commence once the lift station in TMP 4 is completed. Footpath on the northern kern will be closed for the duration of works ( TMP 5)
All works will involve investigation of the construction area to identify underground services. These areas will then be excavated. In the case
of the lift stations, sheet piling may be installed. Construction of the structures will be carried out under an appropriate TMP, and upon
completion, all excavations in the carriage way will be backfilled reinstated and resurfaced. Any affected kerb, channel, footpaths and berms
will also be reinstated and TTM will be removed.. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: Daytime (7am - 6pm)

properties.description:
Various roads within the central city. Works under generic plans
Storm and waste water repairs.
Spot Repairs
Multiple spot repairs area required. The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged spot removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Spot repairs will require up to three days to complete.
Section Repairs
Multiple section repairs are required The works will involve CCTV of the damaged line to locate the repair. The location will then be excavated, the damaged section removed and replaced, and then backfilled and resurfaced. Section repairs will require up to 10 days to complete, 

Lining
Once all spot and section repairs are completed, these mains will then need to be lined. Lining will take place mostly during day time hours between 7am and 5pm or restricted to 9am to 4pm on the higher capacity roads. Lining works will generally require closures over two manholes, one of which is likely to be in the middle of an intersection. TTM for lining works will be deployed and removed daily as needed. Lining contractors may complete up to 3 lines per day, so up to 3 different closures a day may be required

Works under site specific plans
Site specific plans will be added to the TMP as investigation works progress. It is assumed all works carried out under generic plans will not reduce capacity, and that site specific plans will be provided in most other cases as they are identified. These works will also be updated to the FWV when they are submitted for approval. Durations for any site specific plans will be similar those prescribed above.

Note: Any planned generic one way systems will be communicated to CTOC, Signals and ECAN a week before commencement.. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: Daytime (7am - 6pm)
properties.impact: Pedestrians Affected. Cyclists Affected. Bus Route / Stop Changes. Property Access Affected. Parking Removed. Vehicle Lane(s) Closed. Shoulder Closure.

properties.description:
666 Pages Rd to New Brighton Rd. Day works
Works will begin with investigations and crack repairs to the underside of the bridge, requiring a lane width reduction on either side of the bridge depending on the works. (TMP 2&3) Also during this time, the removal of the central island will be needed(TMP 1). Following that replacement of the handrails/wingwalls will take place under the same TM arrangement. 
The next stage of works will be the relocation of the service mains which area currently above ground on the southern footpath, and need to be moved to the underside of the bridge on the northern side. This will take place over three stages, with extended work areas similar to those of the previous stage (TMP 4,5&6)
The final stage of works will be the reinstatement of the kerb and channel as well as road resurfacing. These will take place under a combination of the attached TMP?s


Night Works
Night works will be implemented for the resurfacing of the road surface. A one way system restricting the eastbound traffic will be implemented from 6pm until approx. 11pm.  (TMP 7 & 8)
After the final westbound bus has passed through, a full road closure will be implemented until 5:30am, at which point the carriage way wil be returned to two way traffic.  (TMP 9 & 10)
Night works are expected to take up to 4 night s to complete between the 1/2/2016 and 22/2/2016. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: Daytime (7am - 6pm)

OPERATION:
CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware, St Albans & Strowan Catchments

Storm Water
-New pipe relay across and longitudinally to carriageway and footpath.
-Localised dig down repairs in the carriageway and footpath.
-CCTV pipe investigation from man holes and kerb side sumps.
-Flushing and cleaning of pipes from manholes and kerb side sumps.
-Pipe Lining and pipe patching installation from manholes and kerb side sumps.

Roading
-Full road rebuilds including carriageway to a depth of 500mm, kerb, berm and footpath.
-Minor shoulder repairs to carriageway, kerb, berm and footpath.
-RAMM repairs including localised carriageway, kerb, berm and footpath repairs.
-Minor repairs to the Bishop St Culvert wing walls

TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT: 
Road closures with detours
Priority / Give Way
Manual Traffic Control
One Way systems
Contraflows etc?

COMMUNICATION:
For further information please contact the Fletcher Construction Company - 0800 444 919. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: All Day (24 hours a day)

properties.description:
Ferry Rd between Ryan St and #537 Ferry Rd. Works will begin at the intersection pedestrian crossing east of the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. The raised island on the north side
of the crossing will be removed so that two-way traffic can safely be maintained while the repair works are carried out. Works will be carried out
under a contra flow, with MTC as a contingency at night if the work area needs to be increased. Pedestrians will be directed to the pedestrian
crossing at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Smith St. Once the island has been removed, temporary pavement will be laid up to level with the
existing road. (TMP 1, SC Generics)
Construction works are in the intersection of Ferry Rd and Hopkins St. Two-way traffic will be maintained along with a north bound one way
system on Hopkins St. Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the
required depth, repairs will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level.
Throughout works pedestrians will be redirected to alternate crossing at Ferry Rd/ Smith St. As these works are in close proximity to a school,
a contingency plan for MTC before and after school hours may be implemented to facilitate the safe travel of children to and from school.
(TMP 2, 2a,3,SC Generics)
Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island, and reopening of the
pedestrian crossing (TMP1, SC Generics)
This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete.
The next repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Isabella St. The first stage of these works will be the removal of a 20m section of the
raised island separating east and west bound traffic. A centre of road closure with TSL will be implemented and removal works will take place
at night, with partial closure of the east bound right turning lane on Ferry Rd. Due to the location of works, the removal of this section of the
island is required so that west bound traffic can be directed in to the east bound right turning lane, as the east lane bound lane will be too
narrow due to the work area. (TMP 4a, 4b)
Due to the close proximity of works to the Ensors Rd intersection, a shorter taper and longitudinal safety zone will need to be installed. Water
fill barriers will be used to reduce the risk of traffic entering the work area. Site access will require vehicles to enter at the sign posted site
access point and reverse in to work area. The bus stop at the intersection of Ferry/Isabella will be relocated approx.150m west on Ferry Rd for
the duration of works.
Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs
will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 5a,5b)
Once construction works have been completed, work site will revert back for the reinstatement of the raised island. (TMP 4a, 4b)
This section repair is expected to take 40 days to complete.
Upon completion of this section repair, works will shutdown for the holiday period, and resume on the 4th of January at the following location
The final repair will be at the intersection of Ferry Rd and Manning Place. A contra flow with TSL and road closure of Manning Pl with east
bound detour will be implemented for the duration of these works. Existing bus stops on the north and south sides of Ferry Rd will both be
relocated 100m east on their respective sides.
Initial works will be a shallow excavation for the installation of sheet piling for the trench. Excavations will proceed to the required depth, repairs
will be undertaken, backfill of excavation, removal of sheet piling, then reinstatement of surface up to road level. (TMP 6a,6b,7)
This section repair is expected to take 25 days to complete.. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: All Day (24 hours a day)

OPERATION:
CIR: This project consists of the following operations in various locations within the Edgeware and St Albans Catchments

The gravity wastewater main is the pipe that takes wastewater from private laterals through to the pump station. The existing gravity wastewater pipe has suffered multiple breaks due to the earthquakes and needs to be replaced. To complete the gravity wastewater renewal we need to dig trenches ranging from 1.1-2.5 metres deep. Dewatering, using spears and extraction pumping, will be required to drop the water table in the trenches at all times. Excavation will proceed once the ground is dry, using trench shields. A new PVC (polyvinyl chloride) pipe will be installed, then laterals will be renewed and attached at the private property boundary. There may need to be some excavation done at your boundary.

After replacement of the waste water pipe the carriageway will be reinstated and sealed, road markings will be applied if applicable.

Please note: CCTV and flushing of lines will be required prior to commencement of main works

TRAFFIC MANAGEMENT: 
Road closures with detours
Priority / Give Way
Manual Traffic Control
One Way systems
Contraflows etc?

COMMUNICATION:
For further information please contact the Fletcher Construction Company - 0800 444 919. Not Significant. Time(s) of day affected: All Day (24 hours a day)

Installation of a new vacuum sewer system in parallel to keeping the existing system in operation.  This involves installation of collection Chambers ? in council land, vent stacks on private boundaries and the install of new vacuum mains. Final hook up to the new system will happen only when the vacuum pump station is built and commissioned.  The pump station is due for completion in Early 2016 and is being done by other parties outside this contract.

Due to the ground conditions and high water table this area went through a rigorous design process comparing it to Pressure WW and Vacuum WW.
